zone.line: commence: this town was five miles
off. We hired a chaise here, and with
four hour horses drove with speed
through the storm. My garments were
wet and clung around me, and my hair
hung in straight locks on my neck
when not blown aside by the wind. I
shivered, yet my pulse was high with
fever. Great God! What agony I endured.
I shed no tears but my eyes wild and
inflamed were starting from my head; I
could hardly support the weight that
pressed upon my brain. We arrived at
the town of — in a little more than
half an hour. When my father had arriv
ed the storm had already begun, but
he had refused to stop and leading leaving
his horse there he walked on – towards
the sea. Alas! It was double cruelty
in him to have chosen the sea
for th his fatal resolve; to me it
was adding madness to ^my despair.
